member.name: DIBSECTION
member.summary: The DIBSECTION structure contains information about a DIB created by calling the function. A DIBSECTION structure includes information about the bitmap's dimensions, color format, color masks, optional file mapping object, and optional bit values storage offset. An application can obtain a filled-in DIBSECTION structure for a given DIB by calling the function.

member.name: DIBSECTION.dsBm
member.summary: A data structure that contains information about the DIB: its type, its dimensions, its color capacities, and a pointer to its bit values.

member.name: DIBSECTION.dsBmih
member.summary: A structure that contains information about the color format of the DIB.

member.name: DIBSECTION.dsBitfields
member.summary: Specifies three color masks for the DIB. This field is only valid when the BitCount member of the structure has a value greater than 8. Each color mask indicates the bits that are used to encode one of the three color channels (red, green, and blue).

member.name: DIBSECTION.dshSection
member.summary: Contains a handle to the file mapping object that the function used to create the DIB. If CreateDIBSection was called with a NULL value for its hSection parameter, causing the system to allocate memory for the bitmap, the dshSection member will be NULL.

member.name: DIBSECTION.dsOffset
member.summary: The offset to the bitmap's bit values within the file mapping object referenced by dshSection. If dshSection is NULL, the dsOffset value has no meaning.
